FuncDef:
The broadcast discard command prevents an EVC Layer 2 sub-interface from forwarding broadcast packets to other EVC Layer 2 sub-interfaces in the same bridge domain (BD).
The undo broadcast discard command enables an EVC Layer 2 sub-interface to forward broadcast packets to other EVC Layer 2 sub-interfaces in the same bridge domain.
By default, an EVC Layer 2 sub-interface can forward broadcast packets to other EVC Layer 2 sub-interfaces in the same bridge domain.
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
An EVC Layer 2 sub-interface can forward received broadcast packets to other EVC Layer 2 sub-interfaces in the same bridge domain. Forwarding malicious unknown unicast packets increases device resource consumption. As a result, device performance deteriorates, or a device breaks down. To prevent an EVC Layer 2 sub-interface from forwarding broadcast packets to other EVC Layer 2 sub-interfaces in the same bridge domain, run the broadcast discard command.
Precautions
The broadcast discard command applies to networks without user changes or networks with static MAC address-based forwarding paths.
